documentation.text: @return the generator of G1
@return the generator of G2
@return the negation of p, i.e. p.addition(p.negate()) should be zero.
@return r the sum of two points of G1
@return r the sum of two points of G2

@return r the product of a point on G1 and a scalar, i.e.
 p == p.scalar_mul(1) and p.addition(p) == p.scalar_mul(2) for all points p.

@return the result of computing the pairing check
 e(p1[0], p2[0]) *  .... * e(p1[n], p2[n]) == 1
 For example pairing([P1(), P1().negate()], [P2(), P2()]) should
 return true.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) pure returns (struct Pairing.G1Point memory[] memory)
function (uint256) pure returns (struct Pairing.G2Point memory[] memory)
function (struct Pairing.G1Point memory[] memory,struct Pairing.G2Point memory[] memory) view returns (bool)

documentation.text: Convenience method for a pairing check for two pairs.
